intro: Cyrtandra lysiosepala var. pilosa, commonly known as the hairy Cyrtandra, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in rainforest understories. Due to its restricted habitat and conservation status, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
